schemes.name: PM-KISAN Samman Nidhi
schemes.description: Income support of Rs.6000 per year to all farmer families across the country in three equal installments of Rs.2000 each every four months.
schemes.benefits: Rs. 6,000 per year transferred directly to bank account in 3 installments of Rs. 2,000 each
schemes.how_to_apply: Visit nearest CSC center or apply online at pmkisan.gov.in. Village Patwari/Revenue officer can also help with registration.
exclusions: Professionals like doctors, engineers, lawyers with practice

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Urban)
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
schemes.description: Affordable housing scheme providing financial assistance for construction or purchase of houses for the urban poor and middle class through interest subsidy on home loans.
schemes.benefits: Interest subsidy: EWS/LIG up to Rs. 2.67 Lakh, MIG-I up to Rs. 2.35 Lakh, MIG-II up to Rs. 2.30 Lakh on home loans
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through nearest bank branch, Housing Finance Company, or online at pmaymis.gov.in
exclusions: Families already owning a pucca house
Previous beneficiaries of any housing scheme

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (Gramin)
schemes.description: Provides financial assistance for construction of pucca houses with basic amenities to rural poor who are houseless or living in kutcha/dilapidated houses.
schemes.benefits: Rs. 1,20,000 in plain areas and Rs. 1,30,000 in hilly/difficult areas + 90 days MGNREGA wages + toilet under SBM
schemes.how_to_apply: Selected from SECC 2011 data by Gram Sabha. Apply through Gram Panchayat or Block Development Office.

schemes.name: Ayushman Bharat - PM Jan Arogya Yojana (PMJAY)
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
schemes.description: World's largest health insurance scheme providing free health coverage of Rs. 5 lakh per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization to economically vulnerable families.
schemes.benefits: Rs. 5,00,000 cashless health insurance per family per year covering 1,500+ procedures at 25,000+ empaneled hospitals
schemes.how_to_apply: Check eligibility at mera.pmjay.gov.in, visit nearest CSC/empaneled hospital to get Ayushman card
exclusions: Families not listed in SECC 2011 data (unless added by state)

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Ujjwala Yojana 2.0
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Gas
schemes.description: Free LPG connections to women from BPL households and other identified categories to replace unclean cooking fuels with clean LPG.
schemes.benefits: Free LPG connection + first refill + hot plate/stove. No address proof needed under 2.0 (self-declaration accepted)
schemes.how_to_apply: Visit nearest HP/Bharat Gas/Indane distributor with documents

schemes.name: Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana
schemes.description: Small savings scheme for girl child providing one of the highest interest rates among government schemes. Account can be opened for girls below 10 years of age.
schemes.benefits: 8.2% annual interest rate (highest among small savings). Tax free under 80C. Min deposit Rs.250/year, max Rs.1.5L/year. Matures at age 21.
schemes.how_to_apply: Visit any Post Office or authorized bank (SBI, PNB, BOB, etc.) with girl's birth certificate
exclusions: Maximum 2 accounts per family (exception for twins/triplets)

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Mudra Yojana
schemes.description: Provides collateral-free loans up to Rs. 10 lakh to non-corporate, non-farm small/micro enterprises including vendors, shopkeepers, and artisans.
schemes.benefits: Shishu: Up to Rs.50,000 | Kishor: Rs.50,001-5,00,000 | Tarun: Rs.5,00,001-10,00,000. No collateral needed. Interest: 8-12%
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply at any bank branch, NBFC, MFI, or online through mudra.org.in / psbloansin59minutes.com

schemes.name: National Scholarship Portal - Post Matric Scholarship for SC/ST/OBC
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
schemes.description: Scholarships for SC/ST/OBC students studying at post-matriculation level (Class 11 and above) to support their education expenses and reduce dropout rates.
schemes.benefits: Full tuition fee reimbursement + monthly maintenance allowance: Day Scholar Rs.1,200/month, Hosteller Rs.3,000/month
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply online at National Scholarship Portal (scholarships.gov.in) during the application window

schemes.name: Atal Pension Yojana
schemes.description: Guaranteed pension scheme for unorganized sector workers. Monthly pension of Rs. 1,000 to Rs. 5,000 after age 60 based on contribution amount and age of joining.
schemes.benefits: Guaranteed monthly pension: Rs.1,000 (premium Rs.42-291/month) to Rs.5,000 (premium Rs.210-1,454/month) depending on age at joining. Spouse pension on death.
schemes.how_to_apply: Visit any bank or post office where you have savings account. Auto-debit facility from bank account.
exclusions: Members of statutory social security schemes like EPF/NPS

schemes.name: Stand Up India
schemes.description: Facilitates bank loans between Rs. 10 lakh and Rs. 1 crore to at least one SC/ST and one woman borrower per bank branch for setting up greenfield enterprises.
schemes.benefits: Composite loan Rs.10 Lakh to Rs.1 Crore covering 75% of project cost. Repayment: 7 years. Moratorium: up to 18 months.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply at any Scheduled Commercial Bank branch or online at standupmitra.in. Each branch must give at least 1 SC/ST and 1 woman entrepreneur loan.

schemes.name: Stand Up India (Women Entrepreneurs)
schemes.description: Facilitates bank loans between Rs. 10 lakh and Rs. 1 crore to women entrepreneurs for setting up greenfield manufacturing, services or trading enterprises.
schemes.benefits: Composite loan Rs.10 Lakh to Rs.1 Crore for women entrepreneurs covering 75% of project cost. Repayment: 7 years.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply at any Scheduled Commercial Bank branch or online at standupmitra.in

schemes.name: PM Vishwakarma Yojana
schemes.description: End-to-end support to traditional artisans and craftspeople working with hands and tools through training, modern tools, credit, and market access.
schemes.benefits: Rs. 15,000 toolkit grant + collateral-free loans (Rs.1L first tranche, Rs.2L second) at 5% interest + free skill training + digital payment incentive
schemes.how_to_apply: Register at nearest CSC center or pmvishwakarma.gov.in with Gram Panchayat/ULB certificate
exclusions: Self-employed under other MSME schemes receiving same benefits

schemes.name: Indira Gandhi National Disability Pension Scheme
schemes.description: Monthly pension to persons with severe or multiple disabilities (80%+) living below poverty line. Part of National Social Assistance Programme.
schemes.benefits: Central share: Rs.300/month (18-79 yrs), Rs.500/month (80+ yrs). States add additional amount (total Rs.500-2,000 depending on state).
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through District Social Welfare Office, Gram Panchayat, or state NSAP portal

schemes.name: PM Shram Yogi Maandhan Yojana
schemes.description: Voluntary and contributory pension scheme for unorganized workers like street vendors, rickshaw pullers, domestic workers, washermen, etc.
schemes.benefits: Guaranteed monthly pension of Rs. 3,000 after age 60. Equal matching contribution by Government. Spouse gets 50% family pension.
schemes.how_to_apply: Visit nearest CSC center or self-enrollment through maandhan.in portal

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana
schemes.description: Comprehensive crop insurance scheme providing financial support to farmers suffering crop loss/damage due to natural calamities, pests, diseases. Covers entire crop cycle.
schemes.benefits: Insurance at low premium: 2% for Kharif, 1.5% for Rabi, 5% for horticulture. Full claim settlement without capping. Covers sowing to post-harvest losses.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through bank (mandatory for loanee farmers), CSC center, or insurance company before sowing season deadline
exclusions: Crops not notified by state government for that season

schemes.name: Mahila Shakti Kendra
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Women and Child Development
schemes.description: Empowerment of rural women through community participation, awareness generation on government schemes and programs, skill development, and digital literacy.
schemes.benefits: Free skill development training, digital literacy programs, health awareness camps, scheme enrollment assistance, self-help group formation support
schemes.how_to_apply: Contact nearest Anganwadi center, Block Development Office, or District Women & Child Development Office

schemes.name: Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Grameen Kaushalya Yojana (DDU-GKY)
schemes.description: Demand-driven skill training and placement program for rural youth from poor families with focus on regular monthly wages in formal sector jobs.
schemes.benefits: Free skill training (3-12 months) + guaranteed placement with minimum Rs.6,000/month salary + post-placement support for 12 months
schemes.how_to_apply: Contact nearest Gram Panchayat, Block Development Office, or DDU-GKY Project Implementing Agency
exclusions: Above 35 years (45 for SC/ST, PwD, women)

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Jeevan Jyoti Bima Yojana
schemes.description: Low-cost life insurance scheme providing death coverage of Rs. 2 lakh for all causes of death at a premium of only Rs. 436 per year.
schemes.benefits: Rs. 2,00,000 life insurance cover for any cause of death. Premium auto-debited from bank account yearly.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply at any bank branch where you have savings account. Give consent for auto-debit of premium.
exclusions: Person must be alive at the time of enrollment

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Suraksha Bima Yojana
schemes.description: Accident insurance scheme providing coverage for accidental death and disability at an annual premium of just Rs. 20.
schemes.benefits: Rs. 2,00,000 for accidental death or total permanent disability. Rs. 1,00,000 for partial permanent disability. Premium: Only Rs. 20/year.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply at any bank branch. Premium of Rs.20 auto-debited from savings account annually.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana
schemes.description: National financial inclusion mission to ensure access to financial services like banking, credit, insurance, and pension for every household in India.
schemes.benefits: Zero balance bank account + Free RuPay debit card + Rs.2 Lakh accident insurance + Rs.30,000 life cover + Overdraft up to Rs.10,000 + DBT facility
schemes.how_to_apply: Visit any bank branch with Aadhaar Card. Account opened on same day with simplified KYC.

schemes.name: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act
schemes.description: Guarantees 100 days of wage employment per year to every rural household whose adult members volunteer to do unskilled manual work. World's largest employment program.
schemes.benefits: 100 days guaranteed employment per household at state minimum wage (Rs.200-350/day). Unemployment allowance if work not provided within 15 days.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply for Job Card at Gram Panchayat. Once issued, demand work in writing.

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana (PMKVY 4.0)
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship
schemes.description: Flagship skill development scheme providing free short-term training, recognition of prior learning, and industry-relevant certifications to youth.
schemes.benefits: Free skill training (2-6 months) + NSQF certification + Rs.8,000 reward on certification + placement assistance + training allowance
schemes.how_to_apply: Visit nearest PMKVY training center or register at skillindia.gov.in / pmkvyofficial.org

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Matru Vandana Yojana
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Women and Child Development
schemes.description: Cash incentive for pregnant and lactating women for first living child to partially compensate for wage loss during childbirth and child care.
schemes.benefits: Rs. 5,000 in 3 installments: Rs.1,000 (on registration), Rs.2,000 (after 6 months), Rs.2,000 (after birth registration & first vaccination). Additional Rs.6,000 for 2nd child if girl.
schemes.how_to_apply: Register at nearest Anganwadi Centre or approved health facility. Apply through PMMVY portal or Anganwadi worker.
exclusions: Women in regular employment in govt/PSU (receiving paid maternity leave)

schemes.name: Janani Suraksha Yojana
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
schemes.description: Safe motherhood intervention promoting institutional delivery among pregnant women especially from BPL families to reduce maternal and neonatal mortality.
schemes.benefits: Cash assistance: Rs.1,400 (rural) / Rs.1,000 (urban) for institutional delivery. Free transport to hospital. Free medicine and diet during stay.
schemes.how_to_apply: Register at nearest government hospital, ANM/ASHA worker, or Primary Health Centre during pregnancy
exclusions: All SC/ST women eligible regardless of BPL (in LPS states)

schemes.name: National Pension System (NPS)
schemes.description: Market-linked voluntary pension scheme for all Indian citizens. Offers choice of investment in equity and debt with tax benefits.
schemes.benefits: Market-linked returns (8-12% historically). Tax deduction up to Rs.2 Lakh (1.5L u/s 80CCD(1) + 50K u/s 80CCD(1B)). Partial withdrawal allowed.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through any Point of Presence (PoP - banks, post offices) or online at enps.nsdl.com

schemes.name: Indira Gandhi National Old Age Pension Scheme
schemes.description: Monthly pension for elderly persons from BPL families aged 60 years and above. Part of National Social Assistance Programme (NSAP).
schemes.benefits: Central contribution: Rs.200/month (60-79 years), Rs.500/month (80+ years). States add Rs.200-800 more. Total pension varies Rs.400-2,000 by state.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through Gram Panchayat, Block Development Office, or state NSAP portal

schemes.name: Indira Gandhi National Widow Pension Scheme
schemes.description: Monthly pension for widows from BPL families aged 40-79 years under the National Social Assistance Programme.
schemes.benefits: Central contribution: Rs.300/month (40-79 years), Rs.500/month (80+ years). States add additional amount.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through Gram Panchayat, Block Development Office, or District Social Welfare Office

schemes.name: Senior Citizens Savings Scheme (SCSS)
schemes.description: Government-backed savings scheme exclusively for senior citizens offering one of the highest interest rates and quarterly interest payouts.
schemes.benefits: 8.2% annual interest (paid quarterly). Max deposit Rs.30 Lakh. Tax deduction under 80C. 5-year tenure (extendable by 3 years).
schemes.how_to_apply: Visit any Post Office or authorized bank branch with age proof and deposit amount

schemes.name: PM SVANidhi - Street Vendor Scheme
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs
schemes.description: Micro-credit facility for street vendors providing affordable loans to resume their livelihood affected by COVID-19 and to promote digital transactions.
schemes.benefits: Working capital loan: 1st loan Rs.10,000 → 2nd Rs.20,000 → 3rd Rs.50,000. 7% interest subsidy. Cashback up to Rs.1,200/year on digital payments.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply online at pmsvanidhi.mohua.gov.in or through nearest bank/ULB office
documents: Vending Certificate/Letter of Recommendation from ULB

schemes.name: Startup India Scheme
schemes.ministry: Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade (DPIIT)
schemes.description: Flagship initiative to build a strong ecosystem for startups in India through tax benefits, easier compliance, funding support, and incubation.
schemes.benefits: 3-year income tax exemption, self-certification for 9 labour/environment laws, 80% rebate on patent fees, Fund of Funds (Rs.10,000 Cr), Seed Fund up to Rs.50L
schemes.how_to_apply: Register at startupindia.gov.in, get DPIIT recognition, then apply for specific benefits
exclusions: Turnover above Rs.100 Crore in any year
Formed by splitting/reconstruction of existing business

schemes.name: Kisan Credit Card (KCC)
schemes.description: Provides affordable credit to farmers for crop production, post-harvest expenses, and allied activities. Now covers fisheries and animal husbandry too.
schemes.benefits: Crop loan up to Rs.3 Lakh at 4% interest (after subvention). Credit limit based on landholding and crop pattern. Insurance cover included.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply at any commercial bank, cooperative bank, or regional rural bank with land documents

schemes.name: Swachh Bharat Mission - Gramin (Phase 2)
schemes.description: Mission to achieve universal sanitation coverage by providing free individual household toilets and promoting solid/liquid waste management in rural areas.
schemes.benefits: Rs. 12,000 per household for toilet construction (from Centre+State). Additional support for solid/liquid waste management at village level.
schemes.how_to_apply: Contact Gram Panchayat or apply through Swachh Bharat Mission portal (SBM-G). Block Development Office handles approvals.
exclusions: Households already having a functional toilet

schemes.name: Jal Jeevan Mission (Har Ghar Nal Se Jal)
schemes.description: Aims to provide functional household tap connection (FHTC) to every rural household by 2024, ensuring potable piped water supply of 55 lpcd.
schemes.benefits: Free piped tap water connection delivering 55 liters per capita per day of potable water. Quality testing at village level.
schemes.how_to_apply: Contact Gram Panchayat or Village Water and Sanitation Committee (VWSC). Priority given to SC/ST hamlets, drought-prone areas.

schemes.name: PM Surya Ghar Muft Bijli Yojana
schemes.ministry: Ministry of New and Renewable Energy
schemes.description: Provides subsidy for rooftop solar panel installation in residential households, enabling free electricity of 300 units per month.
schemes.benefits: Subsidy: Rs.30,000 (1kW) to Rs.78,000 (3kW+). Free electricity up to 300 units/month. Sell surplus to grid and earn.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply online at pmsuryaghar.gov.in. Select vendor, get installation, claim subsidy after net meter installation.

schemes.name: PM KUSUM Yojana
schemes.ministry: Ministry of New and Renewable Energy
schemes.description: Kisan Urja Suraksha evam Utthaan Mahabhiyan for installation of solar pumps and grid-connected solar power plants by farmers.
schemes.benefits: Component A: Solar plants on barren land. Component B: Standalone solar pumps (60% subsidy). Component C: Solarize existing pumps (60% subsidy).
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through state agricultural/renewable energy department or at mnre.gov.in

schemes.name: INSPIRE Scholarship
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Science and Technology - DST
schemes.description: Innovation in Science Pursuit for Inspired Research. Scholarship for meritorious students pursuing natural and basic science courses at BSc/MSc/PhD level.
schemes.benefits: SHE component: Rs.80,000/year for BSc/MSc in Natural Sciences (top 1% in Class 12). Fellowship: Rs.25,000-28,000/month for PhD researchers.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply online at online-inspire.gov.in during the application window (typically Sept-Nov)
exclusions: Students not in top 1% of Class 12 board exams

schemes.name: Central Sector Scholarship Scheme
schemes.description: Merit-based scholarship for college and university students from non-creamy layer families, awarded to top percentile students of Class 12 board exams.
schemes.benefits: Rs.10,000/year (1st-3rd year) and Rs.20,000/year (4th-5th year) for professional courses. Rs.20,000/year for M.Phil/PhD programs.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply online at National Scholarship Portal (scholarships.gov.in)
exclusions: Students with family income above Rs.8 Lakh

schemes.name: NSFDC Self-Employment Loan for SC
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
schemes.description: Provides concessional loans to Scheduled Caste families for self-employment ventures through State Channelizing Agencies.
schemes.benefits: Loans up to Rs.15 Lakh for self-employment at 4-6% interest. Up to Rs.25 Lakh for education. Special loans for women SC entrepreneurs.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through State Channelizing Agency (SCA) or District SC Welfare Office

schemes.name: NSTFDC Self-Employment Loan for ST
schemes.description: Provides concessional loans to Scheduled Tribe families for income-generating activities and self-employment ventures.
schemes.benefits: Loans up to Rs.15 Lakh for self-employment at 4-6% interest. Special schemes for adivasi women entrepreneurs. Skills training linked.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through State Channelizing Agency (SCA) or Tribal Welfare Department

schemes.name: e-Shram Card (Unorganized Workers Registration)
schemes.description: National database for unorganized workers providing a unique Universal Account Number (UAN) and linking them to social security schemes.
schemes.benefits: Accidental insurance of Rs.2 Lakh (free with registration). Access to PM-SYM pension, PMJJBY, PMSBY. Emergency COVID relief eligibility.
schemes.how_to_apply: Register online at eshram.gov.in or visit nearest CSC center. Self-registration via mobile available.

schemes.name: Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Scheme
schemes.description: Comprehensive welfare scheme for registered construction workers providing benefits for education, health, housing, marriage, pension, and more.
schemes.benefits: Children's education: Rs.8K-25K. Marriage: Rs.25K-50K. Maternity: Rs.15K-30K. Pension: Rs.2K-5K/month. Death benefit: Rs.2-5 Lakh. Medical: Up to Rs.1 Lakh.
schemes.how_to_apply: Register at State Labour Department or BOCW Board office. Apply for specific benefits after registration.
exclusions: Workers with less than 90 days of construction work in preceding 12 months

schemes.name: National Means-cum-Merit Scholarship (NMMS)
schemes.description: Scholarship for meritorious students from economically weaker sections studying in Class 9-12 in government schools to arrest dropout rate.
schemes.benefits: Rs. 12,000 per year (Rs.1,000/month) for Class 9 to 12. Renewed annually on maintaining 55% marks.
schemes.how_to_apply: Appear for state-level NMMS exam in Class 8. Apply through school or State Education Department.

schemes.name: Pre-Matric and Post-Matric Scholarship for Minorities
schemes.description: Scholarships for students belonging to minority communities (Muslim, Christian, Sikh, Buddhist, Jain, Parsi) to support their educational development.
schemes.benefits: Pre-Matric: Rs.100-600/month + annual fee reimbursement. Post-Matric: Rs.1,200-3,000/month + full fee reimbursement.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply online at scholarships.gov.in during application period (usually Aug-Oct)
exclusions: Income above Rs.2 Lakh for pre-matric, Rs.2.5 Lakh for post-matric

schemes.name: Assistance to Disabled Persons (ADIP) Scheme
schemes.ministry: Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
schemes.description: Provides assistive aids and appliances to persons with disabilities to improve their mobility, communication, and daily functioning capacity.
schemes.benefits: Free aids: Wheelchairs, hearing aids, prosthetics, crutches, Braille kits, cochlear implants (up to Rs.6 Lakh), smart phones with screen readers.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through ALIMCO camps, District Disability Rehabilitation Centre, or ADIP implementing organizations
exclusions: Income above Rs.3 Lakh (for free aids, those above may get at subsidized rate)

schemes.name: PM Employment Generation Programme (PMEGP)
schemes.description: Credit-linked subsidy scheme for setting up new micro-enterprises in manufacturing and service sectors generating continuous sustainable employment.
schemes.benefits: Subsidy: 15-35% of project cost (max Rs.50L for manufacturing, Rs.20L for service). General: 15-25%, SC/ST/Women/PwD: 25-35%.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply online at kviconline.gov.in. Applications routed through KVIC/KVIB/DIC.
documents: Education Certificate (min 8th pass for above Rs.10L)

schemes.name: National Rural Livelihood Mission (DAY-NRLM)
schemes.description: Aims to reduce poverty by enabling poor households to access gainful self-employment and skilled wage employment through Self-Help Groups.
schemes.benefits: SHG formation + Rs.15,000 revolving fund + Rs.3 Lakh community investment fund + bank linkage up to Rs.10 Lakh + interest subvention at 3%
schemes.how_to_apply: Contact Block Mission Management Unit or Gram Panchayat to join/form Self-Help Group

schemes.name: Pradhan Mantri Vaya Vandana Yojana
schemes.description: Pension scheme for senior citizens (60+) operated by LIC providing guaranteed return and monthly/quarterly/half-yearly/yearly pension.
schemes.benefits: Guaranteed 7.4% annual return. Monthly pension: Rs.1,000 (min invest Rs.1.62L) to Rs.9,250 (max Rs.15L). 10-year tenure.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply online at LIC website or visit nearest LIC branch with deposit amount
exclusions: Investment exceeding Rs.15 Lakh per senior citizen

schemes.name: National Family Benefit Scheme
schemes.description: One-time lump sum assistance to BPL families on the death of the primary breadwinner (18-59 years) from the household.
schemes.benefits: One-time grant of Rs. 20,000 to the bereaved household within 4 weeks of death of breadwinner
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through Gram Panchayat/Block Development Office within 12 months of death
documents: Aadhaar Card of deceased and applicant

schemes.name: Majhi Kanya Bhagyashree Yojana
schemes.description: Financial assistance to girl child from families in Maharashtra through insurance and savings bond. Encourages girl child education and delays marriage.
schemes.benefits: Rs. 50,000 insurance + fixed deposit amount given to girl on turning 18 years (after completing Class 10). Additional benefits for single girl child.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through Gram Panchayat, Municipal Corporation, or Zilla Parishad office within 1 year of girl's birth
exclusions: Family with more than 2 children (unless sterilization done)

schemes.name: Mukhyamantri Kanya Sumangala Yojana
schemes.ministry: Uttar Pradesh Government - Women Welfare Department
schemes.description: Financial assistance of Rs. 15,000 to families in UP for girl child from birth to graduation in 6 installments at different stages of life.
schemes.benefits: Total Rs.15,000 in 6 stages: Birth(Rs.2,000), Vaccination completion(Rs.1,000), Class 1(Rs.2,000), Class 6(Rs.2,000), Class 9(Rs.3,000), Graduation(Rs.5,000)
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply online at mksy.up.gov.in or through District Probation Officer / CDO office
exclusions: More than 2 daughters in a family (exception for twins)

schemes.name: Mukhyamantri Chiranjeevi Swasthya Bima Yojana
schemes.description: Universal health insurance for all families in Rajasthan providing cashless treatment up to Rs. 25 lakh per family per year at empaneled hospitals.
schemes.benefits: Rs. 25 Lakh cashless treatment per family per year covering 1,576 packages at 600+ empaneled hospitals. Registration: Rs.850/year for non-eligible families.
schemes.how_to_apply: Register at nearest e-Mitra center or empaneled hospital with Jan Aadhaar card

schemes.name: Amma Two Wheeler Scheme
schemes.ministry: Tamil Nadu Government - Social Welfare Department
schemes.description: 50% subsidy on purchase of two-wheelers for working women in Tamil Nadu to support their daily commute to workplace.
schemes.benefits: 50% subsidy (up to Rs.25,000) on purchase of two-wheeler for working women. Direct subsidy to bank account.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply online through Tamil Nadu Social Welfare portal or through Taluk office

schemes.name: Bhagya Lakshmi Scheme
schemes.description: Financial assistance to girl children born in BPL families in Karnataka. Provides staged assistance from birth to Class 10 plus maturity bond at age 18.
schemes.benefits: Rs.19,300 in stages (birth to Class 10) + Rs.1,00,000 bond maturity at age 18 + Health insurance Rs.25,000. Scholarship for education.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through Anganwadi center or Gram Panchayat within 1 year of girl's birth

schemes.name: Ladli Laxmi Yojana 2.0
schemes.ministry: Madhya Pradesh Government - Women & Child Development
schemes.description: Financial assistance scheme for girl children in MP providing Rs.1.18 Lakh through education-linked installments and college admission support.
schemes.benefits: Total Rs.1,18,000 in stages. Rs.4,000/year (Class 6-9), Rs.6,000 (Class 11), Rs.6,000 (Class 12), Rs.25,000 for college. Rs.1 Lakh on marriage/age 21.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through Anganwadi center or online at ladlilaxmi.mp.gov.in within 1 year of birth

schemes.name: Mukhyamantri Kanya Utthan Yojana
schemes.description: Comprehensive scheme for girl child education and empowerment in Bihar providing Rs.54,100 from birth to graduation in multiple installments.
schemes.benefits: Birth: Rs.2,000 + Age 1: Rs.1,000 + Age 2: Rs.2,000 + Uniform: Rs.600-1500/year + Class 12: Rs.10,000 + Graduation: Rs.25,000. Total: ~Rs.54,100
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through school/college or online at edudbt.bih.nic.in for graduation component

schemes.name: Kanyashree Prakalpa
schemes.ministry: West Bengal Government - Department of Women Development
schemes.description: Conditional cash transfer scheme for girls in West Bengal to incentivize education and prevent child marriage. Won UN Public Service Award.
schemes.benefits: K1: Annual Rs.1,000 scholarship for girls 13-18 in Class 8-12. K2: Rs.25,000 one-time grant at age 18 (if unmarried and in education).
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through school or online at wbkanyashree.gov.in

schemes.name: Rythu Bandhu Investment Support Scheme
schemes.description: Direct investment support to farmer families in Telangana for each crop season to help purchase seeds, fertilizers and other inputs.
schemes.benefits: Rs.10,000 per acre per year (Rs.5,000 per crop season for Kharif and Rabi). Direct transfer to farmer's bank account.
schemes.how_to_apply: Land-owning farmers are automatically identified. Verify details at Agriculture Extension Office.

schemes.name: YSR Amma Vodi
schemes.description: Financial assistance to mothers/guardians of school children in AP to encourage them to educate their children and reduce school dropouts.
schemes.benefits: Rs.15,000 per year to mothers of children studying in Class 1-12 in government/aided schools. Directly transferred to mother's bank account.
schemes.how_to_apply: Mother/guardian enrollment through school or Volunteer system. Automatic for eligible families.

schemes.name: LIFE Mission Housing Scheme
schemes.description: Livelihood Inclusion Financial Empowerment - Comprehensive housing scheme to make Kerala homeless-free by providing houses to landless and homeless families.
schemes.benefits: Free house construction (Rs.4-6 Lakh depending on category). Land + house for landless. Apartments in urban areas.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through Local Self Government body (Panchayat/Municipality). Beneficiary list prepared by Grama Sabha.

schemes.name: KALIA Yojana (Krushak Assistance for Livelihood and Income Augmentation)
schemes.description: Financial assistance to small and marginal farmers, landless agricultural labourers, and vulnerable cultivators in Odisha for livelihood support.
schemes.benefits: Small/Marginal Farmers: Rs.10,000/year (2 installments for Kharif & Rabi). Landless: Rs.12,500/year for livestock/fishery. Vulnerable families: Rs.10,000/year.
schemes.how_to_apply: Automatic enrollment from SECC/land records data. Verify at Block Agriculture Office.

schemes.name: Mukhyamantri Parivar Samridhi Yojana
schemes.description: Social security scheme providing life/accident insurance and pension benefits to eligible families in Haryana through a single registration.
schemes.benefits: Rs.6,000/year. Covers: PMJJBY (Rs.2L life cover), PMSBY (Rs.2L accident), APY pension, PM-KISAN, Fasal Bima through single application.
schemes.how_to_apply: Register with Parivar Pehchan Patra (Family ID) at nearest Antodaya Saral center or cm-psy.haryana.gov.in
exclusions: Income above Rs.1.8 Lakh/year (for BPL components)

schemes.name: Manav Garima Yojana
schemes.description: Provides toolkits/equipment worth Rs.15,000 to individuals from SC community for self-employment in their traditional occupation or trade.
schemes.benefits: Free toolkit/equipment kit worth Rs.15,000 for 28 different trades including carpentry, tailoring, masonry, welding, beauty parlor, etc.
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply at District Social Welfare Office or through esamajkalyan.gujarat.gov.in
exclusions: Already received toolkit under this scheme

schemes.name: Atta Dal Scheme (Punjab)
schemes.ministry: Punjab Government - Food and Civil Supplies
schemes.description: Free distribution of wheat flour and dal to BPL and AAY families in Punjab to strengthen food security for the poorest households.
schemes.benefits: BPL/AAY families: 4kg wheat flour + 1kg dal free every month per person. Distributed through fair price shops.
schemes.how_to_apply: Register at nearest Fair Price Shop with BPL/AAY ration card
